citation.article-title: Rhodospirillum salexigens, spec. nov., an obligatory halophilic phototrophic bacterium

p.s: Description of Rhodospirillum salexigens sp. nov.
Rhodospirillum salexigens (sal. ex'i.gens, L. n. sal salt; L. exigens demanding, salexigens salt-demanding)
Vibrio to spiral-shaped, 0.6-0.7 μm by 1-6 μm.
One complete turn of spiral 0.8-0.9 μm wide and 3.5 μm long.
Multiplication by binary fission, motile by means of bipolar flagella, Gram-negative.
Intracytoplasmic membranes lie parallel to the cytoplasmic membrane.
Color of anaerobic liquid cultures red.
Photoorganotrophic growth anaerobically in the light or chemoorganotrophic growth aerobically to semiaerobically in the dark.
pH optimum 6.6-7.4.
Growth temperature 20-45°C No growth factors required.
Requires NaCl (5-20%).
Organic substrate assimilated: acetate, pyruvate, citrate, glycerol, glucose and succinate in presence of glutamate.
Not utilized or poor substrates: alanine glycine, arginine, isoleucine, threonine, tryptophan, fructose, serine, leucine, lactate, phenylalanine.
Glutamate is an obligatory N-source.
Casein hydrolysate supports growth and is used as carbon and nitrogen source.
In vivo absorption spectrum shows distinct maxima of bacteriochlorophyll a (375, 590, 800, 840, 875nm) and of carotenoids (485, 515, 550 nm).
Major carotenoids: spirilloxanthin, minor pigments: hydroxyspirilloxanthin, rhodovibrin, rhodopin and anhydrorhodovibrin.
Guanine plus cytosine content of DNA, 64±2 mol % (buoyant density and thermal denaturation).
Habitat.
Partially evaporated pools of sea water with decaying plants.
Illustration: Golecki and Drews, 1980.
Type strain: WS 68; DSM number 2132 (German collection of Microorganisms, Göttingen, FRG).
